rename.from: onedrive backend - support client credential grant
rename.to: onedrive backend - support client credentials grant

body:
Do you want to work on this @gursharan001 ?

I think this needs to be part of the config flow when running `rclone config`.

I think https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/lib/oauthutil/oauthutil.go could be modified fairly easily to do what you need.
Thank you for the pointer. I will attempt it this weekend.

clientcredentials has a separate package which defines it's own config type - https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/oauth2/clientcredentials#Config 

We might have to introduce a flag in rclone config to indicate this.

We will also have to change rest of the code in [oauthutil.go](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/lib/oauthutil/oauthutil.go) to create and use the right config

what do you think?

I also wanted to ask - How to test oauthutil.go ?

> clientcredentials has a separate package which defines it's own config type - https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/oauth2/clientcredentials#Config

Looks annoyingly similar, but different :-(

> We might have to introduce a flag in rclone config to indicate this.

> We will also have to change rest of the code in [oauthutil.go](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/lib/oauthutil/oauthutil.go) to create and use the right config

We need not to break the code in oauthutil as it isn't well covered by tests (and by its nature integration tests are very hard).

I'd be tempted to make a copy of oauthutils say oauthutils/clientcredentials, make it work, then we can look afterwards whether we can factor out the common functionality (like the oauth webserver) afterwards when we see what it looks like.

> I also wanted to ask - How to test oauthutil.go ?

We don't have integration tests or unit tests for this... So its hard, especially with the number of providers rclone supports.
ok. I will attempt your approach over next few days with a new file and try to use it with OneDrive backend.

I think the work for Azure Blob should work for OneDrive as well. Maybe you can get all or most of this for free?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3230
Thank you. This PR looks very promising and I will work with it as well.

issue.title: Implement one drive client credentials

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This change implements OAuth Client Credential flow for the OneDrive backend.

OAuth Client Credential flow will allow rclone to use permissions directly associated with the Azure AD Enterprise application, rather that adopting the context of an Azure AD user account.

As a quick fix, this has been implemented within the onedrive backend code. A more elegant solution would be to implement this within the oauthutil module.

This has been discussed in #6197.

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/6197

#### Checklist

- [ ] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [ ] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [ ] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
My apologies for disappearing. @martin-redmaple, please let me know if you plan to fix the conflicts with your PR. Otherwise I will start a new PR to resolve this. 

Many Thanks.
Thank you @martin-redmaple . I will also test both configurations and report soon.

issue.title: OneDrive certificate credentials support.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Use-Case:
As a maintainer in an organization, I want to configure rclone for OneDrive with certificate credentials, so that I don't need to update the secret frequently.
[Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/active-directory/develop/certificate-credentials]

Background:
Every 90 days, our refresh token expires, requiring us to create a new one to continue using rclone with OneDrive. This maintenance task is inconvenient and time-consuming. Our attempts to extend the 90-day period have been unsuccessful; unfortunately, this duration cannot be changed.

[Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/configurable-token-lifetimes]

body: @gursharan001, have you had a chance to work on this? If you don't think you will, I'd be happy to take it over, though I didn't see anything on your fork yet.

Hi @elovelan , you may go ahead with this.

Cheers.
